synopsis.p: Combines together multiple grid files to produce a single output file at specific intervals.

description.p: Combines together multiple grid files to produce a single output file at specific intervals.
The program is used for combining grid files generated from real-time data feeds. The combination of the two options "-i" and "-o", controls when the files are combined.

By default the median time of all the input records is calculated and used to "window" the output data. The output record contains the data obtained during this median time period. If the "-r" option is specified then the output record will contain data obtained during the most recent time period contained in the input files.

example.description: Combines together all files called "rt.???.grd" to produce a file called "rt.grd". The files are combined starting at 30 seconds after midnight and at every two minutes after that. The data recorded in the output file is from the median time of all the input records.
